SATWord.def: an agreeable way or manner; courtesy; civility: the graceful amenities of society.
an opening, as a hole, slit, crack, gap, etc.
disagreement
fond of or adapted to luxury or indulgence in sensual pleasures; having luxurious tastes or habits, especially in eating and drinking.
not provident; lacking foresight; incautious; unwary.
gross injustice or wickedness.
prohibiting violation; secure from destruction, violence, infringement, or desecration: an inviolable sanctuary; an inviolable promise.
liable or subject to change or alteration.
beginning to exist or develop: the nascent republic.
a movement of the body expressing deep respect or deferential courtesy, as before a superior; a bow, curtsy, or other similar gesture.
a lofty oration or writing in praise of a person or thing; eulogy.
a wooden framework erected on a post, with holes for securing the head and hands, formerly used to expose an offender to public derision.
a small amount or share.
a presentiment or foreboding.
a descendant or offspring, as a child, plant, or animal.
to make known by open declaration; publish; proclaim formally or put into operation (a law, decree of a court, etc.).
rightness of principle or conduct; moral virtue: the rectitude of her motives.
impatient of control, restraint, or delay, as persons; restless; uneasy.
of, like, or befitting a seraph. (a high god)
to exist; continue in existence.
